We are a plumbing company that deals with other contractors and we know based off of experience the good ones from the bad ones, these guys are the good ones! Read Less L. W. Love 5 I had a 22+ years old Trane system. I always had a spring and fall maintenance program in place. While I never had any issues, or needed major repair, I felt that it was the right time to replace it... Read More I had a 22+ years old Trane system. I always had a spring and fall maintenance program in place. While I never had any issues, or needed major repair, I felt that it was the right time to replace it. I am a firm believer in Trane products having had multiple units at multiple homes all with a consistent good experience. I went to Trane’s website for a list of authorized dealers. I also asked a person I knew who is in the construction industry if his company had any experiences with Trane HVAC companies. He gave me a recommendation. I chose three companies and asked for quotes. All were certified Trane Comfort Specialists. One was the friend’s recommendation, one was a company that had performed warranty service on a mini-split system I have and the last one was a company that had good reviews. The dealer with whom I had a prior experience simply sent me an emailed price quote. The second sent a technician by who said someone will be back in contact with a price. It too was sent by email. Zach, with Quality 1 Energy Systems, came out, examined the system and took multiple pictures of it . He then spent time asking about my expectations and my likes/dislikes with the existing system. He shared his photos and made some suggestions including changing out some old duct work that should have been done twenty years ago. He later sent a detailed quote with all the individual pricing and terms. He followed it up with a phone call to answer any questions. To be fair to all companies, I sent them specific questions requesting updated figures for yearly maintenance pricing on our multiple systems, additional duct work costs, and labor charges for any Trane warranty work should it be required. One responded with caveats and minimal detail while the other, not at all. I chose Quality 1 which also happened to be the one my friend recommended. On installation day, Kevin and his team arrived and quickly started the changeover to the new system. They covered the floor and were careful in their handling of both the removal of the old equipment and the installation of the new. After they finished they shared pictures of the completed installation. It was cleaner than they found it! The system has been in for nearly a week and fully meets my expectations. Choosing the right dealer is crucial when investing in an HVAC system, especially with trusted brands like Trane at play. I am happy that I chose Quality 1 Energy Systems. Some restrictions, taxes and fees may apply. View All HVAC Services You Can Count On You Got Questions We’ve Got Answers What does the One Hour mean in your company name? The “One Hour” in our company name indicates our guarantee to be at your home in the predetermined window, your service call fee is waived. Express Appointment: This is an appointment that is scheduled during a specified one-hour time slot. You are promised that a technician will arrive at your home within this one-hour time window. You will also receive a call when the technician is en route to your home. Reserved Appointment: This is an appointment that is scheduled during a specified, two-hour time slot. You are promised that a technician will arrive at your home within this two-hour window. You will also receive a call when the technician is en route to your home. Standard Appointment: This is an appointment that is scheduled during a specified four-hour time slot. You are promised that a technician will arrive at your home within this four-hour time window. You will also receive a call when the technician is en route to your home. Stand-By Appointment: This appointment is for overflow situations. This appointment will not have a specified time. You will receive a call when the technician is en route to your home. Emergency Appointment: This appointment is for an unspecified time after normal business hours Monday-Saturday and all day on Sundays/Holidays. Calls are dispatched in the same order they are received. You will also receive a call when the technician is en route to your home. Do you service emergencies after-hours? Yes, we offer emergency services 24-hours a day, year-round. How much will my service cost? The size and complexity of your HVAC issue will determine the cost. Because our trained, licensed HVAC technicians must diagnose the issue before we are able to quote you an accurate cost, we require an appointment to be set to complete a diagnostic on your system. Once the diagnostic is complete, your One Hour technician will walk you through all costs using our Straightforward Pricing Guide so there are never any surprise fees. How often should I service my HVAC system? It’s ideal to service your cooling system each spring and your heating system each fall to ensure you find small issues before they become big problems. How often do I need to change my HVAC filter? Your filter should be changed every one to three months, depending on conditions in your home and your region’s climate. Do you offer purchase financing? We worked to build relationships with several lenders to ensure our customers are able to restore comfort in their homes. Ask your technician about your financing options. What are the advantages of a smart thermostat? Smart thermostats learn a household’s patterns and adjust heating and cooling according to when a home is occupied, give homeowners the ability to control the thermostat remotely, and enable homeowners to reduce their energy use, saving you money. What is HVAC? HVAC means Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning. HVAC systems refer to air conditioners, furnaces, and any unit that cools indoor spaces during the summer and warm them in the winter. In general, an HVAC system takes in air, heats or cools that air, and blows it into a room or any indoor space. While many homes have separate air conditioning and heating units, others have a heat pump that cools and heats the house. Not only do HVAC systems maintain desired temperatures, but they also improve indoor air quality and regulate humidity levels. But most importantly, these units provide comfort all year round. What is a SEER rating? The SEER (seasonal energy efficiency ratio) is a measure of the efficiency of your heating and cooling system. The higher the SEER rating, the more efficiently a unit operates. The SEER rating of any given unit can range anywhere from 13 to 21. The cost of your AC repair or installation depends on many factors that are rarely, if ever, the same. Because we need to do an onsite assessment, we cannot provide quotes over the phone. Call us and we’ll get you scheduled to get a quote in the Helotes and San Antonio area. What Should I Check Prior to Calling? Before contacting Mr. Wilson Air for furnace repair in the San Antonio area , go through the basics. Make sure you don’t have a dead thermostat or a tripped breaker. Then, put in a new air filter and make sure you have the system set correctly. If none of these things are to blame, reach out to us for a furnace diagnostics check. How Often Should I Check My Air Filters? You'd be amazed how many HVAC problems are caused by someone forgetting to change their air filter. If you use a 1-inch disposable filter, we suggest replacing those monthly. For people with a 4-inch media filter, two changes a year is often enough. How Do I Know if My Furnace is Under Warranty You'll want to start by finding out when your unit was produced. There's usually a visible production plate on the machine—the placement of it varies by brand and model. Once you have that, look up the manufacturer's warranty and see if yours falls within eligible dates. Note that some HVAC companies offer their own no-lemon and installation guarantees that go beyond what the factory offers. When Should I Have My AC Serviced? In the San Antonio area, we recommend getting your HVAC equipment serviced before the start of each season. In other words, AC maintenance should be done at the beginning of spring, while furnace tune-ups are best done in the fall. What are EERs and BTUs? You might hear our HVAC technician use these acronyms and not know what they mean. A BTU—a British Thermal Unit—is a measurement of heat. An Energy Efficiency Resource Standard (EERS), meanwhile, is a guideline used to represent the energy efficiency of an HVAC system. Why Can’t You Just Refill My Freon? Though your AC unit might work after a coolant refill, that’s a band-aid fix for a much larger problem. Because air conditioners are closed systems, any loss in refrigerant means there’s a leak somewhere. With many older systems using environmentally hazardous substances like R-410—which is now banned in new units and only available via reclamation—getting these refills can end up being more expensive than buying a new air conditioner that uses safer, lower-cost refrigerants. What Can I Do to Reduce My Utility Bills? Heating and cooling your home is the biggest contributor to most electric bills. Fortunately, there are things you can do to keep the prices down. These include: Keeping doors and windows closed Sealing leaks in your ducts and outer openings Scheduling annual furnace and AC tune-ups Community We live in the community that we service so we love to spend time and energy giving back to the people that make this area our home! With over a decade of experience, our team is equipped with the skills and knowledge to get the job done right the first time around. Our team can help with the installation of: Ceiling Saver Kit. If your AC unit is in your attic or the upper levels of your property and your drains get clogged, the water collected during the dehumidification process can overflow onto your ceiling. To avoid a costly ceiling repair, our team can install a ceiling saver kit that collects water from leaks. Included in this kit is also a safety switch that can cut your AC off should a clog or overflow incident occur. Condensate Pump. This pump transfers wastewater to the proper drain, and our team can install the pump in an aesthetically pleasing way so that you don’t have pipes and hoses running across the floor. Easy-to-See Thermostats. This thermostat has large, raised numbers to help those with visual impairments, and they also make a clicking sound as you adjust the degree settings of your system. Hard Start Kit. Without a hard start kit, your compressor can become easily strained when it starts up and has to work harder than necessary. This puts additional stress on the air conditioner, ultimately reducing its lifespan without proper assistance. Installing a hard start kit is an easy way to increase efficiency while giving extra support during initial operation, preventing costly repairs or replacements down the line. Kool Kap. Your outdoor HVAC unit is constantly exposed to the elements (i.e., rain, snow, dirt, leaves, debris, etc.). This debris can collect at the bottom of your unit, which is a danger to your system, as it may rust or erode. To keep leaves and debris away from your unit and keep it clean year-round, we can install a Kool Kap, which protects your condenser. Protective Remote Monitoring Devices. To monitor your HVAC system when you aren’t home, our team can help you install monitoring devices and technology. Surge Suppressors & Lightning Arrestors. During the sweltering summer months, utility companies often face a high demand for electrical power, resulting in a reduction of their output—a phenomenon known as a brown-out. Such events can lead to serious, potentially irreparable damage to your household appliances, particularly your air conditioner. These appliances are specifically designed to operate at certain power levels; when these levels are reduced, the appliances are pushed to their limits, causing undue strain. Additionally, the threat of lightning strikes harming or even destroying your electrical appliances is ever-looming. By installing a lightning arrestor within your breaker box, you can safeguard all your appliances with ease. Time Delay Relay. This device helps you avoid burning out your compressor if your system’s settings are changed too often. With a time delay relay, your thermostat won’t adjust or turn on/off until up to five minutes after the last adjustment. Many customers with children who play with their thermostat benefit from this product. Air Star Now has been helping our customers address their HVAC needs since 2011. Call (713) 597-4457 or reach out to us online today to get started with a free estimate! FAQ: Your HVAC Questions Answered How Often Should I Perform Maintenance on My HVAC System? Regular maintenance is crucial to keep your HVAC system running efficiently and prevent unexpected breakdowns. It's generally recommended to schedule professional maintenance at least twice a year—once in the spring before cooling season and once in the fall before heating season. This ensures that your system is ready to handle seasonal temperature changes efficiently. During these visits, technicians can clean components, replace filters, check for wear and tear, and ensure everything is operating safely. Keeping up with maintenance helps prolong the life of your HVAC in Houston. What Are the Benefits of Upgrading to a Programmable Thermostat? Upgrading to a programmable thermostat can offer significant energy and cost savings. By allowing you to set specific times for heating and cooling to adjust based on your schedule, these devices reduce energy consumption. For example, you can program the system to lower energy use when you're not home and ramp up comfort settings just before you return. Over time, this can lower utility bills significantly while maintaining a comfortable indoor climate. As part of an HVAC contractor in Houston maintenance plan, we can show you how to maximize these benefits. Why Is My Air Conditioner Blowing Warm Air? There are several reasons your air conditioner might be blowing warm air. Common issues include low refrigerant levels, which could suggest a leak; a malfunctioning compressor; or an issue with the thermostat settings. Additionally, blocked or dirty filters can also restrict airflow and reduce cooling efficiency. It's best to have a qualified HVAC technician assess the system to diagnose and resolve the specific issue quickly. How Can I Improve Indoor Air Quality in My Home? Improving indoor air quality involves several strategies. Regularly changing HVAC filters is essential to prevent dust and allergen buildup. Installing air purifiers or whole-home ventilation systems can further enhance air quality by removing contaminants and replenishing stale air. Additionally, maintaining a regular cleaning schedule and managing indoor humidity levels can also significantly contribute to healthier indoor air. Consulting with an HVAC company in Houston can provide you with more options tailored to local concerns. What Should I Do If My Heater Isn’t Working? If your heater isn't working, first check the thermostat settings to ensure it's on the heat mode and set to an appropriate temperature. Also, inspect the circuit breaker to see if it has tripped. If these aren't the issues, the problem could involve the furnace's ignition system or a more complex mechanical failure. At this point, it's recommended to contact Air Star Now to ensure a quick and professional assessment and repair. HVAC stands for “heating, ventilation, and air conditioning.” It’s the central system used to provide heating and cooling to buildings. Why is regular maintenance important? Regular maintenance is crucial because it keeps your HVAC system running smoothly, and prevents costly repairs, saving you money in the long run. Can indoor air be hazardous to your health? Indoor air can sometimes be hazardous to your health if it contains harmful pollutants like carbon monoxide and mold. Luckily, My HVAC Guy has the tools, knowledge, and skill to identify any potential contaminants. We can also install an air quality monitor so you can ensure that your air stays fresh and clean. Are all HVAC filter the same? No. Filters for residential spaces are generally smaller than larger ones used in commercial buildings like businesses and hospitals. Choosing the right air filter has an important impact on your air quality. We’ll help you find the right one for your space. How can I eliminated indoor odors? Working ventilation is essential for ridding your home or property of unwanted odors. Check out our air vent cleaning services to ensure you have the cleanest, best working air vents around. How do I choose the right humidifier? The right humidifier for you depends on your needs. There are many different humidifier types, including cool mist, warm mist, ultrasonic, evaporative, and vaporizers. Consult with one of our professionals for recommendations on the right humidifier for you. How often should I clean my air filter? Generally, you should clean your home air filter about every 90 days. This timeframe can vary depending on the number of residents or pets. We recommend scheduling regular cleanings to keep your filter immaculate and your mind at ease. Residential air filters should be cleaned every 20-45 days, depending on the amount of foot traffic the building receives. How often should I check my air filter? You should be checking your air filter about every 30 days. For best results, arrange regular check-ups with us to make maintenance a breeze. Should I have my air ducts cleaned? Yes. Clogged air ducts can lead to shortness of breath, poor air quality, and erratic temperatures. Regular cleanings will keep these problems at bay and ensure you always have clean air. What size heating and air conditioning system do I need? The size of the HVAC system you need depends on the type of property you have (residential or commercial) and your individual needs. Schedule a free consultation with My HVAC Guy for insight on what your property requires. How is the efficiency of heating and cooling equipment measured? We use multiple systems to determine the efficiency of your HVAC equipment. We employ everything from the EER (Energy Efficiency Ratio) to the MERV (Minimum Efficiency Reporting Value). Call us now to learn more. Why is the temperature uneven in my property? Clogged air ducts, a draft, a broken HVAC system—these are all possible causes of fluctuating temperatures. Schedule an assessment with My HVAC Guy to learn what’s troubling your HVAC system. How much does a replacement system cost? The total cost can depend on the size of the system needing replacement. content: AC Genius | HVAC Company in Weatherford TX (817) 341-5149 Home » Home of the AC Genius Home of the AC Genius At Hobson’s Comfort Experts! If you’re reading this, you’re probably thinking one of three things: 1: What the heck is an AC Genius? 2: What happened to the AC Genius website? 3: What about Plumbing and Electrical Geniuses? The answer to #1 is simple — remember the good ol’ days when “he does it for a living” meant “he really knows what he’s doing and he’s darn good at it”? That’s what an AC Genius is. An AC Repair tech that we’ve tested, trained, and screened to really know his trade and be darn good at it. So you get an honest expert who can diagnose the problem right, give you all your repair and payment options, and then fix it right, right then and there. We think that’s just a better way of doing business than sending our a salesman in disguise (aka, a “selling tech”), who’s better at selling than fixing. It’s why we always offer a Free Second Opinion to homeowners who suspect they just might have gotten a salesman instead of an expert AC Repair man . What Happened to The AC Genius Website? Once upon a time in the West, there was a family who grew up in the heating and cooling business, that somehow ended up running three different HVAC companies, all in the same area: Hobson’s Air Conditioning AC Genius Comfort Experts Well, eventually the two brothers thought it would be better to bring all three companies under one roof. That’s how Hobson’s Comfort Experts — Home of the AC Genius was born. So don’t worry, if you loved the service you got from AC Genius — or you were a club member with them — you’ll still get the same great service and club member privileges with Hobson’s Comfort Experts. AND you can be sure of continuing to always get a Certified AC Genius any and every time you call. What About Plumbing Genius and Electrical Geniuses? We’ve been serving the Westplex with honest plumbing and electrical service since 1962. And we’ve taken the same approach with every trade: hire for character, train for skill, stand behind your word and your work, and make sure there’s no “weak links” on your team. That’s why we can confidently certify our people as geniuses at their trade and craft. Stand-up guys who are great at fixing stuff, but who like helping people even more. And just like with Heating and Cooling, we also offer our famous Free Second Opinion for plumbing and electrical repairs. If you’re not sure you’re being given the straight scoop on a water heater replacement, sewer repair, or electrical repair, call Hobson’s Comfort Experts and we’ll send you a certified Plumbing Genius or Electrical Genius to shoot you straight and give you all your options. content: Arlington's Best AC Repair and Heating Repair Company Skip to content Call 469-579-9110 NewRise Heating & Cooling Arlington's Premier Heating & Cooling Company Honest. Professional. Guaranteed. 24/7 Emergency HVAC Services Call Now DFW's Most Trusted Heating & Cooling Company Local Experts, Rooted in the Community Transparent Pricing and No-Pressure Recommendations Certified, Experienced, and Vetted Technicians A Reputation Built on Customer Satisfaction The NewRise Process Schedule Your Appointment Contact NewRise Heating & Cooling, your trusted Heating & Cooling company in Arlington, TX. Whether you’re experiencing a sudden breakdown or need routine maintenance, our team of expert HVAC technicians is ready to assist you. Scheduling an appointment is easy— call us or book online , and we’ll set a convenient time for our visit. Thorough Diagnosis and Honest Assessment​ When our AC repair specialists arrive, they’ll conduct a comprehensive inspection of your system. Using state-of-the-art tools and extensive experience, our HVAC technicians will pinpoint the issue and provide a transparent, honest assessment. We believe in clear communication, so you’ll know exactly what’s wrong and what it will take to fix it. Expert Repair and Quality Assurance​ With your approval, we’ll proceed with the AC repair or heating repair. Our Heating & Cooling company prides itself on efficient, reliable repairs that restore your comfort quickly. After the repair, we’ll test your system to ensure it’s operating at peak performance. Your satisfaction is our priority, and we won’t consider the job done until your AC is running smoothly. Our Services Air Conditioning Services Learn More Heating Services Learn More Air Quality Services Learn More FAQ How often should I have my HVAC system checked? Most homeowners benefit from having their HVAC looked at twice a year—once before summer and again before winter. It keeps things running smooth and helps catch small issues early before they get expensive. How often do I need to change my air filter? It depends on your home. For most, every 1–3 months is enough. But if you’ve got pets or allergies, it’s smart to check it monthly. If it looks dusty or gray, it’s time to swap it out. What are signs my HVAC system might need repairs? Some red flags include strange noises, uneven temps in different rooms, or if your energy bill jumps unexpectedly. If it’s blowing warm when it should be cold, it’s definitely time to get it checked. When should I think about replacing my HVAC system? If your unit’s over 12–15 years old, needs constant repairs, or just can’t keep up anymore, it might be time to upgrade. Newer systems are more efficient and can actually save you money over time. Do you offer emergency repair services? Yes—if your AC goes out in the middle of a heatwave or your heater quits during a freeze, we’ll be there. We run 24/7 to keep homes safe and comfortable no matter what. What types of HVAC systems do you install? We work with central air, ductless mini-splits, heat pumps, and more. Whether it’s a new install or replacing something old, we’ll help you pick the right setup for your home and budget. Can you help improve my home’s air quality? Absolutely. From air purifiers to whole-house humidifiers and better filtration, we offer solutions that can cut down dust, allergens, and even odors inside your home. How long do HVAC systems typically last? With routine maintenance, most systems last anywhere from 15 to 20 years. Skipping tune-ups can shorten that lifespan, so it pays to stay on top of it. Do you offer financing for new systems? Yes, we have financing options that make getting a new unit easier on your wallet. Just ask—our team will walk you through the details and help you find the best fit. Are your technicians certified? Yes, every tech we send out is licensed, trained, and experienced. We don’t cut corners—just quality work by pros who know what they’re doing. support@newrisehvac.com (469) 579-9110 1003 Enterprise Pl #101 Arlington, TX 76001

Air conditioning replacement and conversion to refrigerated air offers significant energy saving benefits. A system that is 25 years old uses twice the energy required to operate a new system, so replacing it with a new energy efficient air conditioner or refrigerated air unit results in considerable home energy bill savings. When purchasing a new home air conditioning system, choosing the right size is important. Many people believe that bigger is always better, but this is not the case when buying an air conditioner for your home. An air conditioning system that is too large is more expensive and uses more energy. In addition, a system that is too large for your home will cycle more frequently, which reduces energy efficiency. At Western Electric, we help you select the right system for air conditioning replacement. We consider the size of the home, number of windows, insulation, shade, home appliances, and number of people in your home to determine the capacity required. Age of Your AC Equipment As your air conditioning unit ages, the likelihood of potential damage and needed air conditioner repairs increases. Most systems last 10 to 15 years. This recommendation is to prevent escalating repair costs and energy bills. Older air conditioning equipment can become challenging to fix due to unavailable parts. Often, old air conditioning units fail to provide even temperature distribution. Issues like insufficient refrigerant levels affect performance and cause temperature fluctuations. The right AC system for your space and routine maintenance can prevent issues over time. Recognizing the signs of trouble early can avoid costly repairs later. Birdwell AC & heating does regular assessments of your AC system to ensure its longevity and efficiency. Keeping an eye on AC performance helps pinpoint when AC repairs are needed. Checking and Replacing AC Air Filters Regularly checking and replacing air filters prevents performance issues in air conditioners. Dirty filters obstruct airflow, making the air conditioner work harder than it needs to. Replacing filters every 1-3 months enhances energy efficiency and improves indoor air quality. Automation services like FilterFetch or even Birdwell AC & Heating simplify routine maintenance by delivering filters on schedule. Consistent maintenance lowers energy costs and boosts the life of the unit. A well-maintained filter reduces the need for frequent ac repair and maintains optimal AC system performance. Inspecting Circuit Breakers Inspecting circuit breakers is an important part of troubleshooting AC issues. A flipped switch often means a more serious problem. A tripped breaker might indicate an underlying bigger power issue that needs immediate attention. AC Repair Corpus Christi, TX Beat The Heat & Stay Cool! It's best to have your A/C system inspected and serviced once a yearâideally in the spring before peak summer heat. Regular maintenance helps catch small issues early and keeps your unit running efficiently. Is it worth getting a high-efficiency HVAC system for this heat? Yes, especially in Texas where systems run hard for much of the year. High-efficiency units can lower your energy bills significantly and keep your home more consistently comfortable in extreme temperatures. How long will my A/C last in this Texas weather? With proper maintenance, most A/C units in Texas last around 10â15 years. The intense heat and humidity can shorten a systemâs lifespan if itâs not regularly maintained. How do I know what size unit I need for my house? The right size depends on your home's square footage, insulation, layout, and more. content: HVAC Contractor Grapevine TX | AC Repair & Install 5.0/5 from 151 Google reviews Licensed & Insured 27 Years Experience We do more than "AC and heat." We fix comfort problems that normal tune-ups ignore: hot rooms, humidity, high bills, and air quality in real Grapevine homes. What homeowners in Grapevine actually want fixed Here's what we hear in Grapevine: "The back bedrooms are always hot," "The air feels humid and sticky," "The bill jumped a lot this summer," "One room smells dusty when the system kicks on." Those are comfort and air quality problems, not just "equipment problems." Replacing equipment without fixing airflow, leakage, and insulation usually does not solve those complaints. It just makes the same issues more expensive. What we do as your HVAC contractor We approach the home like a system. The goal is steady temperature, controlled humidity, clean indoor air, and lower wasted energy. We provide: • AC repair and performance restoration • Heating and furnace repair • Duct sealing and airflow balancing room by room • Attic insulation and air sealing to reduce heat gain and heat loss • Indoor air quality and filtration upgrades • Equipment replacement when it is actually the best answer Everything starts with our paid $89 Comfort Audit . You get a documented readout of what is driving the comfort problem. You see recommended fixes in writing. No pressure language. Just facts and next steps. Typical Grapevine project pricing → Duct sealing / airflow correction: $1,500–$3,500 → Attic insulation and air sealing: $2,000–$6,000 → Whole attic performance package: $4,000–$10,000 → Indoor air quality systems: $800–$4,000 → Full system replacement (when appropriate): $10,000–$20,000+ Proof from Grapevine A Grapevine homeowner near Main Street had one upstairs room that stayed 6 degrees hotter than the rest of the house. After airflow correction and sealing duct loss, that room now sits within about 1 degree of the thermostat, and cooling runtime dropped significantly. What Grapevine homeowners say "One upstairs room stayed 6 degrees hotter. After airflow correction and sealing duct loss, that room now sits within 1 degree of the thermostat." Brandon T. The goal is steady temperature, controlled humidity, clean indoor air, and lower wasted energy — not just equipment replacement. How much do typical HVAC projects cost in Grapevine? Duct sealing and airflow correction runs $1,500–$3,500. Attic insulation and air sealing costs $2,000–$6,000. Full system replacement when appropriate is $10,000–$20,000+. Do you really show the data from diagnostics? Yes. We measure temperature, humidity, airflow, and pressure. You see the numbers and we explain what they mean in plain language. Who we are a fit for If you only want the absolute cheapest short-term patch, we are probably not your contractor. If you want the house to finally feel comfortable and efficient and you want to understand exactly why it hasn't, that is our lane. We also do preventative maintenance and tune-ups prior to the major seasons. These include cleaning and inspecting the unit before any problems occur to prevent a major repair from being needed in the future. These can catch small problems before they damage other parts of the equipment or cause an entire system malfunction. Preventive maintenance can be a lot of help in avoiding costly repairs or replacements and can save you the headache of dealing with unexpected issues. If you are interested in this service, call today and get scheduled with one of our certified technicians! We want to help before its urgent, save yourself the time and energy today! Working with us is a different type of experience. We are not your average corporate office. We are a family growing and hoping to do for the community it is apart of. We are a company based in Amarillo, TX., and we cherish our hometown roots. We want to offer our customers a true and honest service at a great price. We are a family trying to help families get back to comfort as quickly and easily as possible. Call now and see what we can do for your unit and your home. We know how big of a change one repair can cause so get it fixed up today! We are also preparing ourselves for the R22 phase out that will begin in January of 2020. This will affect homeowners that will need freon for their older equipment. Any equipment manufactured before 2010 will use R22 and will need to switch to R410-A refrigerant or a replacement refrigerant. R22 will be available temporarily afterward but only until each vendor sells out. Eventually it will no longer be sold anywhere and the homeowner will still have to flush their system and replace the freon. R22 will come at a high price and will only be a temporary fix. The money spent on R22 can be invested in new equipment or replacing the freon with an actual replacement freon. If your equipment is still using R22 refrigerant, it is probably an older unit that will, sooner rather than later, need repairs or to be replaced. We have a full explanation of this located on our website at snowbearair.com that goes in-depth about the different types of freon, what all the options are and why it is not only something to consider but something to prepare for! Unexpected changes can be overwhelming and a headache to deal with. However, if there is a plan involved, it can be dealt with ease. If you have any questions or concerns on what you should do, give us a call! 806-367-9416 We are very excited to be moving forward with our company and continuing to grow and be able to assist more individuals! If you are in the area, please give us a call and set up your first appointment today for just $7! Frequently Asked Questions How often should air conditioning units be serviced? For optimal performance, it is recommended to have your air conditioner serviced twice a year: once in the fall and once in the spring. In the fall, you should check the air filter, inspect the condenser coils, and make sure the refrigerant levels are correct. In the spring, you should check the evaporator coils, inspect the fan motor, and make sure you check the evaporator coils. What does an AC tune up include? An AC tune up includes a full calibration of the thermostat, inspection of the ductwork for energy loss, tightening and inspection of all electrical connections, evaluation of the blower motor and condition of the blower belt, checking refrigerant charge levels and air flow, inspecting refrigerant leaks, and checking the run capacitor for bulging and/or unusual markings or colors. It is important to have an AC tune up done regularly to ensure that your system is running efficiently and safely. This will help to reduce energy costs and extend the life of your system. Additionally, it can help to prevent costly repairs in the future. What is the most cost effective AC system? The most cost effective AC system for cooling an entire home is the Lennox XC25, which has an outstanding SEER rating of 26 and is rated most efficient by EnergyStar for 2022. For a more affordable option, consider a ductless mini-split AC to cool one or two rooms. Why is my AC running but not cooling? Frequently Asked Questions Does Bralley Works Heating and Air Conditioning offer financing? admin 2025-01-03T15:34:48-06:00 Does Bralley Works Heating and Air Conditioning offer financing? Yes, we work with a local bank to ensure that when an emergency happens, you are able to keep your family safe and sound during the harsh seasons. How can I make my unit last longer? admin 2025-01-03T15:32:01-06:00 How can I make my unit last longer? We understand that you want your system to last as many years as possible. Frequently changing air filters is very helpful. Servicing your HVAC system annually will increase the lifespan of your unit. By servicing your unit routinely, an HVAC specialist can ensure your unit is functioning by replacing any damaged parts and that your freon is fully charged for the upcoming season. How long does HVAC equipment last? admin 2025-01-03T15:33:24-06:00 How long does HVAC equipment last? A HVAC unit should last around 15 years, but efficiency degrades over time, and your energy bill goes up the older your unit is. We have seen units over 30 years old still running, but the energy bill was quite high. We always try to help you keep your HVAC system lasting as long as possible, but sometimes replacing a unit is cheaper than keeping a unit that is using more energy as well as has more expensive parts to replace. Technology within the heating and air conditioning realm has only been increasing in efficiency. Therefore, we suggest sometimes that the best choice is to update your system. How often should I change my air filter? admin 2025-01-03T15:26:39-06:00 How often should I change my air filter? We recommend 1-3 months. This number depends on a variety of factors: how many pets do you have, how old are your windows and doors, and other contaminants that are present in your home. Check your filter frequently to determine if it’s dirty. If it is, then you should change it. We never recommend going over three months before changing air filters. The more often air filters are changed, the more you are able to increase the lifespan on your unit. Is Bralley Works Heating and Air Conditioning open weekends? admin 2025-01-03T15:35:44-06:00 Is Bralley Works Heating and Air Conditioning open weekends? Yes! We understand your HVAC systems don’t just break down on weekdays. We are available 7 days a week! What is a heat pump? admin 2025-01-03T15:34:16-06:00 What is a heat pump? A heat pump is an environmentally friendly and efficient way to cool and heat your home. The heat pump is installed outside your home, using electricity to transfer heat into your home during cold weather, and pull heat from inside your home during warmer seasons. This transfer of heat is all done by refrigerant and does not burn fossil fuels like traditional furnaces. What is a mini-split and why should a professional install? admin 2025-01-03T15:31:00-06:00 What is a mini-split and why should a professional install? A mini-split is a ductless compact heating and air-conditioning system. Some homes don’t have enough space for required duct work on conventional systems or are lacking in room to put a furnace in the home/attic. Mini-splits are also used to supplement rooms that do not get cold or hot enough in your home. We recommend a licensed HVAC professional to install mini-splits because they have the proper tools and equipment to safely install systems up to city code. What size unit should I have for my home? admin 2025-01-03T15:30:04-06:00 What size unit should I have for my home? This question depends on many factors: How old is your home, thickness of walls, r-value of insulation, attic space, the amount of windows and doors in your home, and a lot of other variables! A system that is too small will run constantly, running up your energy bill. Choosing a system too large can result in a home that’s too humid which brings on moisture and mold. Only a qualified HVAC technician can calculate and determine what size unit is best for your home. What types of HVAC does Bralley Works install and repair? admin 2025-01-03T15:35:17-06:00 What types of HVAC does Bralley Works install and repair? We are able to service both commercial and residential properties. Why is my unit freezing up and not cooling my house? admin 2025-01-03T15:29:11-06:00 Why is my unit freezing up and not cooling my house? This isn’t a simple question, but there could actually be many reasons involved. A prominent culprit is that your system is low on freon. This is often due to a leak in your system which is caused by usage over the years, creating pinholes in your system that slowly…or quickly lose freon. Only an HVAC specialist is able to come and find the leaks to repair, as well as properly charge your system to the correct pressure needed. Another common cause is due to a dirty evaporator coil, which then slows the airflow into the home, ultimately leading to the system freezing up. A HVAC specialist is able to assess any damages and properly clean the coil. Why should I update my unit if it uses R-22 freon? admin 2025-01-03T15:28:10-06:00 Why should I update my unit if it uses R-22 freon? Manufacturers no longer make HVAC systems utlizing R-22 freon. R-22 freon is no longer allowed in new equipment due to environmental regulations. Since many existing air conditioning units still use it, R-22 is still produced, but is being phased out. This means that as time goes on, it will become more expensive to repair and harder to find parts for your unit. content: HVAC Contractor in Amarillo, TX - Sutton Heating and Air Skip to content No results Perfect Indoor Comfort Year Round! Keeping Families Comfortable Since 1982 At Sutton Heating and Air , we’ve been helping homeowners and businesses stay comfortable through dry winters and scorching West Texas summers. You’ll find our work in places like Wolflin, Puckett, and Hillside Terrace, each job done with care, not shortcuts. As a licensed HVAC contractor in Amarillo, TX, we focus on long-term fixes, not band; aid repairs. Our technicians show up prepared, explain what needs to be done, and follow through. It’s simple, honest work backed by experience, and that’s exactly what most folks here still value. Call Now! Cool Summers, Cozy Winters No More Surprise Breakdowns Efficiency That Pays for Itself Why Amarillo Chooses Sutton Heating and Air When your Amarillo home’s AC dies in summer or the heater quits during a cold snap, you need someone reliable. That’s us. Sutton Heating and Air has been taking care of our Amarillo neighbors since 1982. We’ve all been through those scorching Amarillo summers and those freezing winter nights. Our team doesn’t mess around, we show up on time and tell you exactly what’s going on without all the technical jargon. We’re not going to push expensive equipment on you if a simple repair will do the trick. Every job gets the same attention, whether we’re fixing a small problem or installing a brand new unit. We believe in fair pricing and doing things right the first time. Plus, we actually clean up our mess when we’re done. Check Out Our Video: Commercial & Residential HVAC Services in Amarillo, TX From offices off Georgia Street to homes in Puckett West, Sutton Heating and Air works with a wide range of heating and cooling systems across Amarillo. We install, replace, and troubleshoot HVAC setups for both residential and light commercial properties. Each job starts with a walk-through and ends with a system built to match the building’s needs, not just the manufacturer’s specs. Our services are listed below, covering everything from full installations to routine inspections. If you’re not sure where to start, these pages offer details based on real questions we hear from customers every week. Furnace Repair & Installation Nobody wants to wake up to a cold house on a freezing Amarillo morning. When your furnace decides to quit working, it’s usually at the worst possible time. We’ve seen it all; from simple thermostat glitches to major component failures that need immediate attention. Most of the time, we can get your heat back on the same day because we stock the parts that fail most often. If your furnace is getting old and repairs are becoming expensive, it might be time to consider replacement. That’s where our complete HVAC System Installation service comes in handy. Sutton Heating and Air handles everything from removing your old unit to getting your new system running perfectly. Heat Pump Repair & Installation Heat pumps are pretty amazing when you think about it; they heat and cool your home using the same equipment. But when something goes wrong, you’re stuck without either heating or cooling until it gets fixed. We work on all the major brands and know these systems inside and out. Installing a new heat pump isn’t something you want to trust to just anyone. The sizing has to be exactly right, or you’ll have problems for years. Our team specializes in New Construction HVAC projects where getting it right the first time matters most. We’re actually certified through the Bonneville Power Administration for heat pump commissioning, which means we know how to make these systems work efficiently. AC System Repair & Installation Summer in Texas doesn’t mess around, and neither should your air conditioner. When your AC breaks down in July, you need someone who can fix it fast. We’ve built our reputation on quick response times and getting systems back up and running the same day whenever possible. Sometimes repair isn’t the smartest choice, especially if your system is older and having frequent problems. Our HVAC Repair Service includes honest assessments about whether fixing or replacing makes more financial sense. When replacement is the way to go, Sutton Heating and Air installs systems that can handle whatever Texas weather throws at them while keeping your energy bills reasonable. Ductless Mini-Split Repair & Installation These ductless systems are becoming really popular, and for good reason. They’re perfect for additions, garages that got converted to living space, or just rooms that never seem to get comfortable. The best part is you can control the temperature in each room independently. We’re a Mitsubishi Diamond Dealer, which means we know these systems better than most contractors. But we also service other brands when things go wrong. For businesses that need precise temperature control without wasting energy, our Commercial HVAC Services include ductless options that can save a lot of money on utility bills. These systems are more sophisticated than they look, so proper installation really matters. Indoor Air Quality Services You might not realize how much dust and allergens are floating around your house until you start paying attention. Amarillo’s wind doesn’t help matters, and seasonal allergies can make life miserable for some families. Poor indoor air quality affects more than just comfort; it can trigger asthma attacks and make respiratory problems worse. We start with detailed HVAC Inspections and Diagnostics to figure out what’s actually in your air and where it’s coming from. Then we recommend solutions that make sense for your situation. Our Indoor Air Quality Solutions range from better filters to whole-house purification systems. Sutton Heating and Air has helped many local families breathe easier at home. Full-Service Amarillo Heating and Air Conditioning You don’t need to tell anyone in Amarillo how fast the weather changes here, triple digits one week, a freeze warning the next. At Sutton Heating and Air, we work with that reality every day. Our crew handles the full range of heating and cooling services, from fixing uneven airflow to replacing old units that can’t keep up. You’ll find us working in neighborhoods like The Colonies, Ridgecrest, and Wolflin, helping customers keep their homes steady no matter what’s happening outside. Below are the core services we handle, each with its own page for more detail. Air Conditioning Contractor Summer in Amarillo hits hard; attic temperatures climb, breakers trip, and older condensers rust in the Panhandle dust. Our Air Conditioning Contractor in Amarillo, TX team replaces worn coils, sizes new high-SEER units for ranch homes in Puckett, and checks airflow in storefronts along 6th Avenue. We measure supply temperatures, inspect electrical loads, and balance ducts instead of guessing. If your current system squeals or struggles past noon, we can spec a replacement or tune the one you have. Air Conditioning Repair Service When the AC cuts out in July, it’s not just uncomfortable—it’s urgent. Our Air Conditioning Repair Service in Amarillo, TX handles no-cool calls across the city, from Sunset Terrace to businesses near Coulter. We don’t just top off refrigerant and leave. We check the whole system—capacitors, contactors, airflow, and control boards—to find what’s really wrong. Whether your unit is short cycling, blowing warm air, or completely silent, we’ll give you a straight answer and a clear path to getting it fixed. Heating Contractor Amarillo winters may be short, but when the cold sets in, a slow or uneven heating system can make a home miserable. As a Heating Contractor in Amarillo, TX, we work on gas furnaces, heat pumps, and electric setups in older homes around San Jacinto and newer builds in Hillside Terrace. Some calls are for simple fixes—others need a closer look. We test key components, inspect wiring, and check for issues that could turn into expensive problems later on. Furnace Repair Service A frost warning can hit Amarillo overnight, and an unresponsive furnace leaves rooms colder than the wind off Palo Duro Canyon. Our Furnace Repair Service in Amarillo, TX tracks down cracked heat exchangers, tired blower motors, and faulty limit switches in homes from Ridgecrest to Lake Tanglewood. We arrive with replacement parts common to local brands, run combustion checks, and test for carbon-monoxide leaks before restarting the system. If a furnace shows signs of age, we explain the options clearly—fix it now or plan for a change-out before next winter. Our Amarillo, TX Service Areas At Sutton Heating and Air, our service areas cover Amarillo and nearby communities, so whether you’re off Loop 335 or near Wonderland Amusement Park, we’re close by. We’re proud to support Potter County and Randall County, including neighborhoods like Puckett, Sleepy Hollow, Ellwood Park, Southeast Park, The Vineyards of Amarillo, Timbercreek Canyon, Rockwell Place, and community zones such as Bushland, Canyon, Cliffside, Pullman, and Washburn. We also extend service to families around the Amarillo Botanical Gardens and businesses by Wonderland. Across all these areas, our team handles furnace and AC repairs, new installs, inspections, and indoor air quality work. You’ll often find us working near parks and schools, ready for urgent fixes after school lets out or routine checkups before winter. Wherever you are in our footprint, expect the same quick response, skilled technicians, and fair pricing that define Sutton Heating and Air. About Sutton Heating and Air In Amarillo, we deal with extremes—100° summers, hard freezes, and wind-driven dust that clogs up outdoor condenser coils faster than most people realize. At Sutton Heating and Air, we’ve spent years diagnosing short-cycling systems caused by cracked heat exchangers, fixing low airflow due to poorly sized ductwork in early 2000s builds, and correcting static pressure problems in older ranch homes across Puckett and Sleepy Hollow. Our crew knows how to handle Lennox and Trane variable-speed systems, how to balance airflow in multi-zone setups, and when it’s time to recommend a heat pump over a gas furnace based on insulation and utility rates, not sales targets. We carry manometers, combustion analyzers, and thermal imaging tools on every van, not just a set of gauges. For more insight into how we work and what sets us apart. Our goal has never been growth for its own sake, it’s been doing the job right. Call Now! Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: How to choose a good HVAC contractor? Start with someone local. In Amarillo, you want a contractor who knows what dust does to coils and how fast temps can swing in spring. Ask if they’re licensed and insured, but also ask how they size a system or what they check during repairs. At Sutton, we’ve worked in everything from small ranch homes to commercial shops. We explain what we’re doing, why it matters, and we don’t disappear after the job’s done. Q2: How do I find an honest HVAC company? Talk to someone who answers questions without dancing around them. An honest HVAC company will tell you what’s wrong, what’s urgent, and what can wait. You should get real answers, not just a sales pitch. We’ve been in Amarillo long enough that word gets around. Sutton doesn’t oversell equipment or pressure folks into contracts they don’t need. We treat your system like we’d treat our own—and that’s how we’ve stayed busy. Q3: Can I install my own HVAC in Texas? You can, but unless you’re licensed, it’s probably not worth it. We’ve seen a lot of DIY jobs go sideways, units too big for the house, poor airflow, ductwork that rattles every time the system kicks on. Most brands won’t honor a warranty unless it’s installed by a pro. When Sutton does an install, we handle permits, pressure testing, airflow balancing, all the details that keep things running right, not just running. Q4: How do I choose an HVAC system? First, pick the system type, central air, ductless, or a heat pump. It depends on how your home is built and what you’re trying to fix. Next, look at efficiency. A higher SEER rating can save you money, but only if the rest of the system is set up right. Last, ask how it’s controlled, smart thermostats, zoning, or simple manual setups. We walk customers through all of this before we recommend anything. Q5: Does brand matter for HVAC systems? It does, but not as much as people think. The biggest difference isn’t the logo on the unit, it’s how well it’s installed. We’ve replaced plenty of high-end systems that were put in wrong. At Sutton, we’ve worked with all the big brands—Trane, Carrier, Lennox, but what we focus on is proper sizing, airflow, and access for future maintenance. A good system installed right will always outlast a great one installed wrong. Q6: What should I look for in an HVAC quote? You want more than just a total price. A good quote will list the model number, the SEER rating, the warranty, and what’s included in the work. If something’s vague or missing, ask. At Sutton, we break it all down, so you know what you’re paying for and why. It’s the kind of quote you can take home, look over, and not feel rushed into. That’s how it should be.

What is HVAC service? HVAC service refers to the routine maintenance, repairs, and sometimes installation performed on your heating, ventilation, and air conditioning system. Think of it as a regular check-up for your system, where a professional inspects, cleans, and tunes components to ensure efficient and reliable operation. 2. How often should HVAC be serviced? It's generally recommended to have your HVAC system professionally serviced at least once a year. Ideally, you should schedule two service appointments annually: one in the spring before the cooling season and another in the fall before the heating season. This ensures your system is running optimally for the demands of each season. For older systems or those in regions with extreme climates, more frequent servicing might be beneficial. Additionally, regularly changing your air filters (every 1-3 months) is a crucial part of ongoing maintenance that you can do yourself. 3. What services does High Tech HVAC offer? We specialize in HVAC installation, repair, and maintenance, including air conditioning and heating systems. Whether you need a quick fix, regular tune-up, or a new system, we’ve got you covered. 4. Why should I choose High Tech HVAC? We combine cutting-edge technology with expert technicians to deliver energy-efficient solutions and exceptional customer service. Your comfort and satisfaction are our top priorities. 5. How often should I schedule HVAC maintenance? It’s recommended to schedule maintenance at least twice a year—once before summer and once before winter—to keep your system running efficiently and prevent unexpected breakdowns. Search

Call Us, We Are Ready to Assist If you need HVAC repair or replacement, the first step is to reach out. Call us to connect with our customer support team, and we'll immediately link you with a local HVAC expert in your area. If You Approve, Your Service is Scheduled If you're satisfied with our offer, our support agent will promptly schedule your HVAC service at a convenient time for you. HVAC Expert Arrives When our HVAC technician arrives, they will assess your needs and provide a clear estimate of the cost before any work begins. If you approve, they will complete the job efficiently. It's that simple! (844)392-0963 × Privacy Policy How We Use Your Information We may use the information we collect from you in various ways, including when you register, make a purchase, sign up for our newsletter, respond to surveys or marketing communications, browse our website, or use other site features. Specifically, we use your information to: Personalize your experience and deliver content and products that interest you most. Improve our website to better serve you. Respond effectively to your customer service requests. Process your transactions quickly. Send periodic emails regarding your orders or other products and services. Follow up with you after correspondence (via live chat, email, or phone inquiries). How We Protect Your Information We prioritize the security of your personal information. While we do not use vulnerability scanning or PCI standards scanning, we do provide articles and information without ever asking for credit card numbers. We do not use Malware Scanning. Your personal information is stored behind secure networks and is accessible only to a limited number of individuals with special access rights. These individuals are required to keep your information confidential. Additionally, any sensitive or credit information you provide is encrypted using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology. We implement a variety of security measures to protect your information when you place an order, submit, or access your information. All transactions are processed through a secure gateway provider and are not stored or processed on our servers. Do We Use 'Cookies'? Yes. Cookies are small files transferred to your computer's hard drive through your web browser (if you allow), enabling the site's or service provider's systems to recognize your browser and capture certain information. We use cookies to: Remember and process the items in your shopping cart. Understand and save your preferences for future visits. Compile aggregate data about site traffic and interactions to improve our site experiences and tools. We may also use trusted third-party services to track this information on our behalf. You can choose to receive a warning each time a cookie is sent, or you can turn off all cookies via your browser settings. If you turn off cookies, some features may be disabled, but you will still be able to place orders. Third-Party Disclosure We may sell, trade, or transfer your Personally Identifiable Information (PII) such as your name, address, email, phone number, etc., to outside parties. Third-Party Links Occasionally, we may include or offer third-party products or services on our website. These third-party sites have their own independent privacy policies, and we have no responsibility or liability for their content or activities. However, we welcome any feedback about these sites to maintain the integrity of our own site. Google We use Google AdSense Advertising on our website. Google uses cookies to serve ads based on users' previous visits to our site and other sites on the Internet. You can opt-out of Google's use of cookies by visiting the Google Ad and Content Network privacy policy. We have implemented: Remarketing with Google AdSense Google Display Network Impression Reporting These features help us compile data regarding user interactions with ads on our site. Opting Out You can set your preferences for how Google advertises to you by visiting the Google Ad Settings page. Alternatively, you can opt-out by visiting the Network Advertising Initiative Opt-Out page or using the Google Analytics Opt-Out Browser add-on. × Terms and Conditions 1. Why people believe in us I thought "something" was wrong with my heater. I called CWS and the gal that answered said she didn't schedule appointments, but would have a tech call me. I was thinking the next day. NOPE. I received a call within ten minutes, and the best news .... the tech was able to see me immediately. Aaron was professional and patient with me, as I asked him a lot of questions, thinking something was wrong with my heater. Thank goodness it was nothing, routine maintenance. DO NOT hesitate to call this company, they are truly amazing. Truly. Dawn A Very pleased based on my one experience. I had a problem with a breaker and had called 3 other places and was repeatedly told that the next available appointment was 2 or 3 weeks out. I called CWS and they were able to come out later that day. My tenant (I wasn't there) said they were very professional and courteous. I did talk to them on the phone and they answered all my questions and explained the problem. The amount charged was very reasonable. I plan to use them soon for something else I need done . Bucky W It's taken me a year to write this review, but I wanted to make sure that people know what an awesome job these guys do! Last summer, I had Juan come out and install a pendant light above my kitchen sink, and asked him to re-route some switches and plugs so that the switch was in a convenient place - he did such a great job, and even put in an outlet with 4 plugs plus two USB ports for charging our phones!! I get compliments all the time about the light, and they always ask who I had put it in - CWS of course! Juan also fixed our dining room switches (there was an extra switch for some reason) and installed a dimmer, so now we can have romantic dinners at home, lol! You can't go wrong using these guys, they go the extra mile and are very good at what they do. Thanks again Juan!! Marita P A/C wasn't cooling. Called and got Kenny. Kenny said he would be here in 20-30 minutes. Guess what, Kenny was here within 20 minutes. He was honest in his findings and said he would have to return the next day due to the condition of my unit. Said he'd be back at 9am. He really showed up by 9am. Got the unit back to blowing nice and cold. I appreciate Kenny keeping his word and being there when he said he would. He gave helpful info about keeping the unit going and info about purchasing a new unit and what the install would be like. I'm thankful for his help and will definitely recommend CWS in the future. As well as call them for future servicing. AAGENHEAV WE TAKE OUR TIME AND EXPLAIN THE PROJECT TO YOU IN A SIMPLE STEP BY STEP DESCRIPTION ALLOWING YOU TO FEEL COMFORTABLE WITH OUR WORK. content: Electrician & Heater Repair in Hewitt TX | Daily Service Company About Daily Service Co. In 2007, Scott and Lisa Daily founded Daily Service Co. with one unwavering principle: persistence . Since their inception, their mission has been to deliver dependable HVAC and electrical services to their neighbors in Hewitt, Woodway, and Waco. As a company, we have committed ourselves to showing up, doing the right thing, and never backing down from a challenge. The bison in our logo represents this spirit of persistence. While most animals run from a storm, the bison charges right into it–head-on. That’s exactly how the Daily Service Co. team deals with every heating , cooling, and electrical issue : directly, fearlessly, and with purpose. We’ve grown over the past 18 years, expanding our team, getting more service trucks, and sharpening our skills. Chad Rutty, one of the owners, went the extra mile to help us and provided excellent information to make sure we selected the correct AC system for our home. Gayle R Chad is very knowledgeable and very good about answering questions and giving information. He did a great job of explaining what was wrong with our AC unit in a clear way. Morris for the past 5 years and they are always prompt, courteous, professional and honest. I couldn’t recommend them more! Donna S Just reviewed my estimate/proposal for the duct repairs needed from Rutty and Morris and it’s the most fair estimate I’ve ever received as a homeowner to date. Today I had an appointment scheduled with them and the technician came out. Due to my situation, and the fact that he wasn’t sure how to help me, he just did a cancellation and I wasn’t charged. A few hours later Chad Rutty came to my home himself and we discussed the best route for me moving forward. In just a few more hours, I received my estimate from him in my email inbox. I can’t say enough about this local business. They could have charged me for the technicians time. I’m so grateful that they didn’t, especially this close to Christmas. They saved my system this summer when I called for servicing. I thought I needed coolant and suspected a leak since the AC wasn’t cooling the home and it kept freezing up and shutting down. Come to find out, another local company that had serviced my system in the Spring had overfilled, which was causing over pressuring of system. They could have just told me they filled it and charged me for coolant but instead, they were honest about the issue and just drained out the extra. They came out about 2 years ago and discussed some issues I was having and suggested a fix that I could do until I was ready financially to put money into the HVAC system, as well as a few other options I had for upgrades. A lot of businesses are out for money. Being a female homeowner, I’ve found that more times than not, I’m given a line of BS with a hefty price tag attached. Not with these guys though. As long as they are in business, I will use them. Honestly and fairness is huge to me. They have been my little glimmer of hope during all of this TPC explosion mess!!! Amanda W Never have to worry about anything when Rutty & Morris is involved. Josh T I had to have duct work done and the team at Rutty & Morris was amazing. From the first phone call into the ladies in the office that are friendly. Jose that came out to give me a bid was punctual and very professional. Colin and his crew that did the work were great! They also were punctual, proficient, knowledgeable and highly trained. I highly recommend them!! Amy S They repaired our unit & serviced our outside unit. Works great Bart C Great service! Friendly people! Mike P My experience was great, when in need, they were there in a no time to troubleshoot and repair George B 5 star Kevin was very informative, professional, along with a very nice, pleasant friendly attitude! Excellent A/C Technician. I would absolutely recommend Rutty and Morris based on very quick response Same day service , friendly receptionist and Kevin that represented the company. Melody L Have always been my go to reliable source for AC work. Tylar Y Chilling in the new AC gotta love it ! Michael L Love these people! Crystal H On a Friday afternoon fan motor & module went out. Had us fixed up in under 2 hrs. Excellent job. Bart C Brent Crow did a very good job; was on time, courteous, informative….very professional! David C Jimmy Caswell did amazing. Very professional and easy to get along with. Doug M Very professional Elton Jimmy called to let me know he was on his way. He answered all my questions and was very efficient. Camille J Very professional work. Got a filtration system and air scrubber to clean my air. No more allergies Katie Exceptional service and knowledge of equipment. Jason P Very courteous, professional service John O I called to get a technician out to check on our ice make at On Stage Hair Design and was told someone would be out Friday afternoon. Within a few hours, a technician arrived. He was friendly and fixed our issue quickly. Carrie F Hometown Heroes!! 24/7 Service with a smile! Good guys, great prices! Emma L By far, the most straightforward and professional HVAC team I have ever worked with. After getting the run around from Fidelity Home Warrenty Company, these guys have set me straight in 24 hours. Charlotte C Unit had a hiccup in October. Tech came out to diagnos. Unit works as should. Tech tells me the problem, but long wait for the board to come in. Winter comes & goes. Unit quit 6/12. Called 6/13 9:30 a.m. tech arrived at 4 p.m. with parts. All they needed was a signature. All of the employees I’ve encountered from estimates to repairs have all been respectful, & actually clean up after themselves very well. Chris M They came out two weeks ago fixed our air conditioner then today one of the capacitors blew up . They came out repaired the damage replaced the capacitor and off he went!!!! They were fast and easy to work with. Rachel B Excellent service, professional and knowledgeable techs and good response times. I have use them. We have never used Rutty and Morris but we had an air conditioning issue and the technician was out here in less than a few hours. He very quickly and efficiently found and fixed our problem in a most professional way!! We will certainly recommend them to anyone we know!! Thank you Rutty and Morris!! Andy Dean C Excellent job. Workers were cordial and hard working all day long. David S The installation technicians (Steve & Johnathan) were very professional with the installation of the A/C and Heating units, clean up, safety and protection of home flooring. James Tomplait J Rutty Air Conditioning is extraordinary. I normally don’t do business recommendations because very few meet my high expectations. I’m a perfectionist and expect the same for my money. Chad Rutty is amazing and went far beyond what most other business owners would do. 2,000 miles away, with renters in my Groves, TX home, I called him and said my a/c was out. In the middle of a heat wave, he dropped everything and immediately went to restore air for the third time in three years. My a/c unit was original to my home, built in 1998. Rutty has kept it running for me, but we decided it was time to replace the unit rather that feeding money into a 24 year old unit. I’m still 2,000 miles away and couldn’t even get a check to him. He trusted me to pay him, and didn’t let the family in my home suffer for a day. His service is exemplary. Tammy T Very professional and on time which is hard to find .Worked quietly and efficiently and stayed below the quoted bid. Wes C I recently had both of my HVAC units replaced with the Daikin units recommended by two of my friends. What a great product and price with a12 year parts and labor warranty. During installation one of the units had a software issue which was corrected by Chad immediately. The other unit was installed with no issues. Both units were installed in a day and a half. Technicians were very professional and knowledgeable. They addressed every question we had. I can’t tell you everything I want to on this review but I recommend Chad and his team for any of your needs. Thanks Rutty & Morris Hoot Landry Richard L Rutty and Morris is a great AC company.The Daikin Fit Chad Rutty sold me is the real deal smart AC it sends monthly diagnostic to my email letting me know how it perform that month, it also come with a 12 year parts and labor warranty .For all your AC and Heating needs give Rutty and Morris a call… Gregory W They just replaced the outdoor unit, furnace, and the coils. They also added in a return air for my upstairs with a whole house filtration system and air scrubber. Last night was the first “cold” night in our house. The office, managers, and all installers were extremely helpful and professional. Highly recommend these guys. Cory P Rutty & Morris was amazing! They were quick, efficient, responsive, on time, and very professional. I would 100% use again and as a Real Estate Agent will be happy and comfortable referring them to clients in the future. Give them a call! Kayla K Swift response on the weekend, polite and professional staff. I’m very happy with their service Amanda J Rutty & Morris were very professional and got the job done on time! They put a new A/C unit at my office and house and had the best price around. Will definitely use them again and highly recommend them! Chris A They were able to come out within 2 hours and diagnosed the problem and had it fixed in half an hour. Very thankful as I was due home from vacation the next day. Will always use Rutty & Morris from here on out. Deanne S Made a call at 8:00am to schedule service……Will was able to troubleshoot some issues that where corrected and got unit back on line!!! Top notch work and service!!! Thank you Will!!! Taylor R Chad Rutty and crew are number 1! Always fair and reasonable. Todd Z 5 stars…most definitely!! These people know their stuff when it comes to A/C installation. The job was very well done…all ductwork and seams sealed and replaced as needed, and the new components sized perfectly to our home. The best technicians in the business. I would definitely recommend them to anyone needing a/ c work! Joseph C Very much enjoyed “Jimmy”,Grate troubleshooter. Ronald H I have a maintenance contract with R & M. Kevin was out today to check the heat side of my system. As promised, at the appointed time, he called me to to say he was on his way to my home. He checked the system & thermostat & then explained his findings. Personable, knowledgeable & professional!! I highly recommend Rutty & Morris for HVAC repair or replacement. Mike H These guys take care of their customers. Will did a great job, discussed issues a the fix and performed my maintenance. Got us up quickly. He was knowledgeable, respectful and through Terry B Technicians are very knowledgable and prompt. Toby G Prompt service and kind people. C D We had been having a problem with our AC unit every 2 months for the last year or so. We’ve only been in our home for 2 years. I have American Home Shield Warranty so I always would call them, they would send a technician out. They NEVER took the time to listen or figure out what was the problem!! Long story short. This time we decided to just go out on a limb && call Rutty && Morris. I’ve called them two times before after hours(on a Friday) when the technician AHS a

Air Conditioning Heating Next » Air Conditioning Please select one My A/C unit isn’t cooling My A/C unit isn’t running My thermostat screen is blank My house is muggy & sticky inside even with the air on My outdoor unit is making a noise « Back Next » This may be caused by your thermostat settings: Solution Be sure your thermostat is turned ON Be sure the thermostat is set to “Cool Mode” and the Fan is set to “Auto”. Be sure the thermostat set point is “at least” set to 3 degrees LOWER than the displayed room temperature. Did that solve your problem? Yes No « Back Next » Awesome!! Glad we were able to help you solve your problem. We’ll be here. If you should need us again. Don’t forget to BOOKMARK our site for any future needs. « Back Your air filter(s) may be dirty Solution Check ALL A/C filters for cleanliness. Clean and/or replace (depending on filter type) if visibly dirty. ** All supply vents and return grills should be open and unrestricted for proper system air flow and cooling effect** Did that solve your problem? Yes No « Back Next » Awesome!! Glad we were able to help you solve your problem. We’ll be here. If you should need us again. Don’t forget to BOOKMARK our site for any future needs. « Back Is the indoor fan running and air blowing out of your vents? Yes No « Back Next » **Your unit may be equipped with a safety float switch that is connected to the condensate drain at your indoor unit. The safety switch could be wired to shut down the outside unit ONLY to prevent further condensate backup and flooding.** Solution Check for a clogged condensate drain and clear if it appears clogged or there is evidence of water on the floor at the indoor unit or standing water is present inside the condensate pipe. NEVER use any chemicals including but not limited to bleach, vinegar, Drain-O inside your condensate drain. The use of anything OTHER THAN HOT water will cause eventual coil rupture and refrigerant leaks. The use of a Wet Vac is preferable for homeowner fixes of a clogged drain. Give your air conditioner a couple of minutes and see if it cycles on. ***NOTE— Your unit most likely has a built in time delay. You MUST allow 10 minutes for the time delay to reset and the system to start-up*** DO NOT keep adjusting the thermostat during this time. Did that solve your problem? Yes No « Back Next » Sounds like you need expert care. Please turn off your system and schedule an appointment. N.A.T.E Certified Technicians! Qualified and Compentent. We at Legit Heating and Air LLC have N.A.T.E service professions to ensure the highest quality of service for our partners in Abilene and the surrounding areas. N.A.T.E stands for North American Technicians of Excellence which is the nation’s largest nonprofit certification organization for heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration (HVACR) technicians. NATE tests represent real-world working knowledge of HVACR systems and validate the professional competency of service and installation technicians. Home and business owners choose HVACR contractors who employ NATE-certified technicians to get repairs done right – the first time. Indoor Air Quality! The quality of air you breath is important. Abilene we are excited to present to you indoor air quality solutions that will solve allergy problems, prevent sickness, and prolong the life of your air conditioning unit. We have partnered with some of the best indoor air quality manufacturers such as APCO and Dynamic to provide you with the latest innovative ways to keep the air you and your loved ones breath clean. Many of our customers are unaware of the harm developing in thetheir air handler and ducts until we come out and perform our maintenance and biological growth assessment. Once we show them the proof they are horrified and wonder why none of the other A.C companies did not inform them about it nor provide a solution. The solutions duct cleaning, bio treatment of the unit and a high output germicidal ultra violet light system installed in your air handler. Maintenance! Invest in your comfort and well being. Give us a call today because biological growth and a lack of maintenance is not like wine, it does not get better over time it gets worse and leads to more expensive air conditioning and furnace repairs. Let us help you and provide you with affordable solutions to problems you may not know you have that can save you thousands of dollars in emergency repairs. We offer monthly investment plans just so our customers can afford the solutions they need to keep their families healthy, comfortable and safe in the comfort of their own home.
